alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 6:30AM PST until January 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected above 2000 feet. Total snow accumulations of up to 12 inches from Toketee Falls west, and 2 to 3 feet inches expected east of Toketee Falls, and over the highest terrain. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph over exposed high terrain and gusting to around 30 to 40 mph east of Toketee Falls to near Diamond Lake. * WHERE...The foothills of the Cascades in Douglas, above 2000 feet. * WHEN...From 1 AM Tuesday to 4 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow will cause whiteout conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall and strongest winds are expected between 10 PM Tuesday and 10 AM Wednesday, with rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Blizzard conditions are possible with a 30% chance for this occuring. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now. &&
